summary: The End Solitary Confinement Act aims to eliminate the use of solitary confinement in federal agencies and entities. It mandates minimum standards for out-of-cell time and meaningful human interaction, establishes a community monitoring body, and provides state incentives to comply with the new standards. The bill also includes provisions for due process, placement hearings, and access to information, while also amending the Civil Rights of Institutionalized Persons Act and prohibiting certain uses of appropriated funds related to construction or restrictive devices.
